author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Coastal oils at Archipelago shop
text:
Coastal oils at Archipelago shop Oct 02, 2015 “Fog over Field" is an oil on panel by Sally Loughridge. 
Rockland — South Bristol artist Sally Loughridge returns to Archipelago at Rockland's' Island Institute this month with oil paintings that reflect her love of Maine's sea-washed coast and wooded landscape. 
Archipelago celebrates its 15th anniversary as the Island Institute store this fall, and Loughridge has exhibited there throughout these years. She also has shown her work in the Archipelago Fine Art gallery twice: in 2008 solo show “Coastal Edges”; and “Monhegan Perspectives III,” a small group show in 2010. 
The Archipelago shop offers handmade art, craft and design representing the very best of Maine's islands and coast. For more information, call 596-0701. For more information about the artist, visit sallyloughridge.com . 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
